newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: High money keeps Sri Lanka rupee afloat vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: High money keeps Sri Lanka rupee afloat vs dollar.

text.p: High money rates supported the Sri Lanka rupee against the dollar, as banks continued to sell the U.S. unit, dealers said.
At 0430 GMT the rupee was at 56.78 to the dollar after opening at its previous closing level of 56.80.
"Although the Central Bank pushed the dollar up in line with movements overseas, high call money is keeping the dollar low locally," said a Deutsche Bank dealer.
The Central Bank pushed up the dollar by two local cents, and fixed buying and selling rates at 55.9474 and 57.0776.
